backend/main.mo: Motoko backend actor providing blood pressure classification and food recommendation logic based on health conditions.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features to frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose of each frontend file in the project.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining a custom OKLCH color palette and theme variables for light and dark modes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entrypoint setting metadata, favicon, and loading the React app.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component handling form state, results view toggling, and layout including hero, header, and footer.
Form component collecting user health data, validating input, and triggering the recommendations query.
frontend/src/components/ResultsView.tsx: Results component displaying health summary, recommended foods, condition badges, and a medical disclaimer.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor based on the current Internet Identity, refreshing dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity context with login, logout, and status handling using Dfinity AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines a mutation hook that calls the backend to fetch food recommendations using the current actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and custom OKLCH color variables for light and dark health-themed UI.
frontend/src/lib/validation.ts: Validates health form inputs including age, weight, and blood pressure with range and logical checks.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentity providers and loads global styles.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind theme extensions, custom colors sourced from CSS variables, plugins, and animations.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, feature status, requirements, and image needs for the health recommendation app.
